question.body: Which of the following characteristics of phospholipids is responsibe for forming a semipermeable membrane?

response.feedback: Incorrect. Phospholipids have nonpolar tails which are hydrophobic and repel water.
Incorrect. Saturated fatty acids keep a membrane stable.
Correct. The combination of polar heads and nonpolar tails creates a membrane that attracts molecules to it but prevents large, charged polar molecules from entering.
Incorrect. There is only one main phospholipid characteristic that makes the membrane semipermeable.
